title: Sri Lanka stocks turn negative in lackluster mid-day trading
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock market indices reversed its early gains after the mid day trading as investors awated for some positive news, stockbrokers said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.29 percent or 23.62 points as of 1202 hours while the most liquid S&P SL20 slipped 0.4 percent or 10.79 points.
“There is nothing to boost the sentiment. Higher interest rate is the main reason for the market fall,” a stockbroker said.
